home.title: WOŚP Barcelona
home.subtitle: Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity in Barcelona
home.description: We are a dynamic community of Poles in Barcelona who for 8 years has been organizing WOŚP Finals and charity events, combining passion with help.

joinSection.title: Join our mission
joinSection.description: Every year we organize the WOŚP Finale in Barcelona, raising funds to buy the most modern medical equipment for Polish hospitals.

cards.helpDesc: We raise funds and organise activities to truly help children and people in need.
cards.businessDesc: We connect companies and people, creating networking and cooperation space.
cards.communityDesc: We build relationships, organise events and connect Poles in Barcelona and surroundings.
cards.cultureDesc: We showcase Polish culture and values, co-creating Barcelona's colourful mosaic.

finalSection.title: 34th WOŚP Finale — Healthy tummies for our kids
finalSection.description: We play to support diagnostics and treatment of gastrointestinal diseases in the youngest patients. Let's take care of healthy tummies together!

contactSection.title: Contact us
contactSection.description: Do you have questions, want to become a sponsor or volunteer? Write to us!

about.title: About us
about.mission: Our mission is to help children and seniors through the organization of charity events in Barcelona.
about.history: We have been supporting the Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity for 9 years, raising funds for the most important goals.

missionCards.title: Supporting those most in need
missionCards.description: We raise funds and organize actions to help the most vulnerable children and elderly. Every zloty goes directly to Polish hospitals for the purchase of modern medical equipment.

missionCards.title: Supporting local businesses
missionCards.description: We connect companies and people, creating space for cooperation. Our partners include Polish companies in Catalonia and local entrepreneurs who want to help and reach new audiences.

missionCards.title: Integration of the Polish community
missionCards.description: We build relationships and organize events that connect Poles in and around Barcelona. It's a meeting place for newcomers, students, and anyone looking for Polish connections.

missionCards.title: Promoting Polish culture in Spain
missionCards.description: We showcase the beauty of Polish culture, art, and traditions. During our finals, we host artists from Poland, and participants can taste Polish cuisine and drinks. Every year, more and more Poles, Catalans, and people from around the world come to experience 'Cultura Polaca' at our final event.

wospHistory.title: History of WOŚP
wospHistory.content: The Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity (WOŚP) is the largest charity organization in Poland, founded in 1993 by Jerzy Owsiak. Over 30 years of activity, it has raised over 2 billion zloty for medical purposes.
wospHistory.events: Every January, WOŚP Finals take place across Poland and around the world – the largest charity events that unite millions of people for one goal: saving the lives and health of children and the elderly.

medicalGoals.title: Medical Goals
medicalGoals.content: WOŚP finances the purchase of the most modern medical equipment for Polish hospitals. Each year has its specific medical goal – from pediatric cardiac surgery, through oncology, to geriatrics.
medicalGoals.impact: Thanks to WOŚP, Polish hospitals have received thousands of devices: from ventilators, through CT scanners, to modern operating rooms. This is tangible help that saves lives every day.

jurek.title: Jerzy Owsiak and the Foundation
jurek.content: Jerzy Owsiak, founder and president of the WOŚP Foundation, is one of the most recognizable figures in Polish social life. A journalist, social activist, and visionary who for decades has been building a social movement based on kindness and help.
jurek.transparency: The WOŚP Foundation operates transparently – every zloty is accounted for publicly. It's an organization that has changed the face of Polish pediatric and geriatric medicine, equipping hospitals with billions of zloty worth of equipment.

barcelonaSection.title: WOŚP Barcelona
barcelonaSection.subtitle: For over 9 years we have been building in Barcelona a unique place where Polish energy and Spanish temperament unite to help.

paragraphs.season1: The WOŚP season runs from early December to the end of January – these are the two most intense months of the year. During this time, we set up our team and meet regularly with the same core group of people.
paragraphs.season2: After the Finale, usually in February, our team disbands and a new one is formed each year. That's why you might not hear much from us between February and November – that's when we return to our families and daily routines.
paragraphs.season3: We often organize internal volunteer meetings during this time to discuss what worked well that year and what we can improve.
paragraphs.volunteers1: We have volunteers who have been with us for years, but we also welcome new people who have just moved to the area and are looking to connect with the Polish community.
paragraphs.volunteers2: We invite students who often help us as part of their internships, which is very helpful during the Finale organization. We welcome all help – even one-time assistance!
paragraphs.volunteers3: We encourage everyone who wants to help, make new friends, or simply be part of the volunteer community to join us.
paragraphs.partners1: We collaborate with many Polish and local Catalan companies. Our main partner, World Class Barcelona, started with WOŚP in Barcelona and now focuses on developing their Spanish language school, but they always support us!
paragraphs.partners2: Another key partner is Kosmo Hispano – a Polish language school for children that helps us organizationally and always organizes various events for children, like Christmas and St. Andrew's Day parties.
paragraphs.partners3: We often meet at the Krakoviak restaurant, which is another one of our main sponsors and supports us from the kitchen!
paragraphs.partners4: All the funds we raise come from sponsors – mostly local ones. We don't have our own funds – everything we have comes from sponsors. We're very grateful to them because without them, the Finales wouldn't happen!

final33Section.title: 33rd WOŚP Finale in Barcelona
final33Section.intro: In January 2025 we organised the 33rd WOŚP Finale in Barcelona. It was our best Finale so far!
final33Section.medicalDesc: The 33rd Finale was dedicated to palliative and hospice medicine. The funds raised were used to purchase medical equipment that helps ensure a dignified life and death for patients in their most difficult moments.
final33Section.photoCreditThanks: Thank you for capturing the wonderful moments from our 33rd Finale!
